file_content.text: It was a pleasure working with you.
Go talk to Nizkif. The sooner you do, the sooner we get paid.
Well, since I haven't been visited by any large, angry Black Sun thugs, I take it you got everything taken care of?
The equipment is history.
Yes, it's done.
The danger is over.
Of course it's taken care of.
Whew... all right, that's great news. What a relief.
Here--something for your trouble. I can't thank you enough for your help.
Ha... you know, it's funny. There are people who would pay a frigate-load of credits for this list.
That list should be going to your superiors!
But you're a security officer!
Maybe so. But they don't pay me nearly enough for the risks I take down here everyday.
So you had an ulterior motive all along.
The real plan comes out.
No, it's nothing like that. I was just thinking, it'd be nice to make a little something extra, wouldn't it?
A Jedi has no need of credits.
I don't want money.
Yeah, yeah, I've heard. But surely a Jedi has expenses just like anyone else.
If you sell the list, you'll be exposed as the thief.
Your plan won't work.
Maybe, maybe not. There are ways to avoid that kind of attention.
I like where this is going.
Sounds good to me.
Sensitive intel like that could cause havoc in the wrong hands.
The list should stay secure.
If the list goes public, everyone on it would be warned--and we'd make a tidy profit.
I could use more credits.
That's the spirit.
I say we seize this opportunity while we can.
That list should be used to save lives.
No, we can't do this.
You just don't give in, do you? Ah, you're right, I shouldn't be looking for a quick profit.
I'll make sure the list ends up in the right hands. Lives are more important than credits anyhow.
See you around, then. Thanks again for all your help.
Let's sell that list for everything it's worth.
I agree.
All right! I know a guy, Nizkif. He's an "information broker."
Take the list to Nizkif, and I'm sure he'll give us a fortune for it.
I'll talk to Nizkif right away. Where can I find him?
Sounds like a plan.
Why do I have to go?
You kidding? People know me at the cantina.
Nizkif had better pay as well as you say.
I'll hold you to that.
Trust me, you'll be very satisfied.
Nizkif hangs out at the Dealer's Den, a cantina in the old Galactic Market. I'll let him know you're coming.
Nizkif will forward my share when it's done, so this is where we part ways. Pleasure doing business with you.
What are you doing back here? You need to get that equipment in the Black Sun base shut down before they track me!
Well. A Jedi. You don't stand out from all the low-lifes down here at all, do you?
Hey. Soldier. Hold up a minute, would you?
Hey. Why don't you hold up a minute?
I'm Folaris. I think you and I should have a private chat.
What can I do for you?
Very well.
[Flirt] How private?
We're talking business, not pleasure.
You want to talk, talk fast.
Keep it short.
Don't worry. It will only take a second.
There's a rumor going around that Black Sun's about to clean house. Snitches, rival gang leaders--they're all gonna be dead meat.
There's a list of these unfortunate individuals sitting on their computers. I need those names.
No problem.
Well, it's not as straightforward as you might think.
Sounds to me like you're in law enforcement.
Are you a security officer?
Let's just say I'm interested in what's best for the people of Coruscant.
You seem to know an awful lot.
Anonymous sources, who need to stay that way.
I can slice into Black Sun's computers and get the hit list, but they'll be able to trace me.
So, while I'm slicing in, I need someone to break into the Black Sun hideout and shut down their tracing equipment. Think you can do that?
Do you really want to put your life in my hands to get this list?
Are you sure about this?
Don't have much choice, do I? I need that list, and I need it yesterday.
You can count on me.
Time to make this happen. All right... go! Go!
You'll have to find someone else to help you.
Not now. [Refuse quest]
Fine, fine. Maybe I'll manage to find someone who actually cares about saving lives.
So long.
You don't want to be hanging around here.
Let's talk about compensation.
Here's the compensation I promised. You did good work.
You'll be adequately compensated for your time.
There's one last detail: You'll only have a few minutes to shut down the tracing equipment before Black Sun ID's me.
Think you can get that tracing equipment down in a short time frame?
I'll shut the equipment down before they trace you.
Yes, I can do it.
Great. All right, let's not waste any time. As soon as you head out, I'll start slicing into Black Sun's computer system from here.
Like I said before, you'll only have a few minutes to break into Black Sun's hideout and shut down the tracing equipment, so move fast.
